definition: dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
lit. to first show one's horns (idiom); fig. a first show of emerging talent/first sign of emerging talent/budding genius
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time

sentences.english: But developing-country banks now have got things right on a number of fronts.
sentences.chinese: 但是发展中国家银行已经开始初露锋芒。

sentences.english: The young man displayed his talent for the first time in the scientific and technological circles.
sentences.chinese: 那个青年人在科技界初露锋芒。

sentences.english: There are new problems on the horizon, just beyond those oil platforms offshore.
sentences.chinese: 就在近海区石油钻井平台之外，新的问题已初露端倪。

sentences.english: His writing style can be seen from this novel.
sentences.chinese: 骆宾基的创作风格在这部小说中初露端倪。

sentences.english: Frailty is a killer, and it can start very early in life.
sentences.chinese: 肌肉纤弱无力是杀手，这在生命中很早就初露端倪了。

sentences.english: Head budding males are conspicuous icons of the need to breed.
sentences.chinese: 初露头角的男性都是引人注目需要交配。

sentences.english: Golden Week holidays, the beginning of fire directed suburbs commercial real estate.
sentences.chinese: 十一黄金周期间，郊区商业地产开始初露锋芒。

sentences.english: A long, hard battle now looms in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 一个艰难的长期性斗争已在参议院初露端倪。

definition: lit. to first show one's horns (idiom); fig. a first show of emerging talent/first sign of emerging talent/budding genius
(of a plant) to be in bud
the sun sets over western hills (idiom); the day approaches its end/fig. time of decline/the end of an era/Sic transit gloria mundi
first rays of morning sun/first glimmer of dawn
to be on the verge of eruption (idiom)/(of the sun) to emerge in all its brilliance
dawn/fig. the dawn of a new era
